intro: Telinaria stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled telinaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Telinaria stenopetala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
